data.title: Crow Boy, First Edition
data.meta_description: Crow Boy (The Crow Boy Trilogy): 1 by Philip Caveney and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. 252 p. 21 cm. Signed by Author Sound and square binding in glossy illustrated boards. Spine slightly cocked. Inside contents are bright and unmarked except for author's inscription. Dustjacket has a little wear along the edges and is shelf rubbed with a few scratches. It is not price clipped. The first of the Boy Sherlock Holmes series of books for children, featuring Sherlock Holmes as a boy detective. In this story, the foundations of Sherlock Holmes, the adult, are set as he solves the mystery of a woman's murder in Victorian London. Inscribed to a previous owner and signed by the author on the title page.

Soft Cover. Condition: Very Good. First Edition. 219 pages. Paperback. Queensland'sfirst boys' reformatory was established on the prison hulk The Proserpine in1871. In 1881, the boys were transferred to some buildings in Lytton. In1900, 88 boys and some of the buildings were transferred to Westbrook, near Toowoomba. This new institution was called the Reformatory for Boys, Westbrook. Crow Fletcher's story of his time at the Reformatory. Size: 8vo.

Paperback. Condition: Good. Taro Yashima (illustrator). 1st edition. Crow Boy by Taro Yashima. Published by Viking Press, New York, NY, Jan 1971. 1st Edition 2nd Printing. No DJ. Size 8vo (up to 9-1/2'' tall). Condition: Good. Orig owners name in ink inside front cover. Repair tape at spine. Content in very good condition. No Pg Count. LCCN 55-13626. Illustrated by the author. Picture book for children. Viking Seafarer edition. Description text copyright 2002 BooksForComfort. Item ID 5561. book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. 1st Edition. First Edition, First Printing (1955 date on title page and states "First Published by Viking Press in October 1955 on the copyright page") of this beautifully illustrated tale of a Japanese school boy with an affinity for crows that was 1956 Caldecott Honor book. Red cloth, 38 pages, color lithograph illustrations. A handsome copy. Bottom fore edge corners are lightly bumped and one interior page a stray ink mark from a previous child owner. No dust jacket.

8vo. [49]-96 pp. Numerous photos & illustrations. Colour illustrated softcovers, cover art of two American Indian children by J.W. Brady (minor dustsoiling, shelfwear), still VG copy. First edition of this scarce issue of the noted quarterly published to benefit the Society for the Preservation of the Faith among Indian Children, to secure funds for Catholic Indian Schools. Of particular interest in this issue are the many photos of Native Americans on Indian Missions, and in Schools, including the Crow Indian Camp in St. Xavier Mission, MT; Catholic Chippewa Children; Crow Indian Archers; Flathead children, St. Ignatius Mission, MT: Navajo Babies; Flathead Indian girls on the Pend Oreille River, and more.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Good+. First Edition; Third Printing. We consider each and every book we sell to be a treasure. That's why we provide accurate individualized condition descriptions; ship in sturdy protective packaging; and offer excellent customer service.; Mauve cloth cover is rubbed at corners and spine caps but clean, bright, and in very good+ condition. Boards and spine are straight. Binding is tight. Former owner's name and book plate on half title page. Pages are clean and pristine. Book appears unread. Dust jacket is tattered at corners and top and bottom edge of spine panel and lightly soiled but bright and in good+ condition. Publisher's price of $3.00 on DJ flap. DJ protected by a brand new, clear, acid-free mylar cover. We add mylar covers to all books with DJs to preserve the DJs and add luster to magnify their beauty. (If pictured, shown without the mylar cover for an accurate representation of dust jacket. ); 9.1 X 6.6 X 1.1 inches; 40 pages.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good-. First Edition. Quarto brown cloth. Minor bumps to the spine ends and upper corners. There is a stamped name and address along with the same in pen to the front free endpaper. The dust jacket has chips to the corners and spine ends. A number of tears and chips along the lower edges and lower spine end. There is a larger piece of about 1" x 2" missing from the upper front spine/front edge area. Original price of $2.75 to the front flap. ; 4to 11" - 13" tall; 37 pages.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. 1st Edition. This copy INSCRIBED WITH A LONG INSCRIPTION AND SIGNED ON FFEP AND WITH AN ORIGINAL FUL PAGE MIXED MEDIA DRAWING ON THE TITLE PAGE. A fine copy lacking the dust jacket. Second printing 1956. Inscribed by Illustrator(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. Taro Yashima (Atsushi Iwamatsu) (illustrator). 1st Edition. Viking,New York, 1955. Hardback. First Edition/Fifth Printing. Fine/Near Fine. Inscribed and stamped by the author on the half-title page. The book has a straight, tight spine with perfect boards. No wear on edges with crisply pointed tips. No internal markings or tears. The dust jacket is 99% complete, price clipped, with tiny losses/tears at spine heel/head and edges. Tiny losses at front tip and back tip and back edge up about half way to the top. Now encase in sparkling new mylar archival jacket. Looks spectacular! This title was an honorable mention for the 1956 Caldecott Medal. Inscribed by Author(s).
